verses.name: Proverbs 13:1
verses.text: A wise son heareth his father’s instruction: but a scorner heareth not rebuke.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:2
verses.text: A man shall eat good by the fruit of his mouth: but the soul of the transgressors shall eat violence.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:3
verses.text: He that keepeth his mouth keepeth his life: but he that openeth wide his lips shall have destruction.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:4
verses.text: The soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul of the diligent shall be made fat.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:5
verses.text: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:6
verses.text: Righteousness keepeth him that is upright in the way: but wickedness overthroweth the sinner.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:7
verses.text: There is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:8
verses.text: The ransom of a man’s life are his riches: but the poor heareth not rebuke.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:9
verses.text: The light of the righteous rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked shall be put out.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:10
verses.text: Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:11
verses.text: Wealth gotten by vanity shall be diminished: but he that gathereth by labour shall increase.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:12
verses.text: Hope deferred maketh the heart sick: but when the desire cometh, it is a tree of life.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:13
verses.text: Whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth the commandment shall be rewarded.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:14
verses.text: The law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:15
verses.text: Good understanding giveth favour: but the way of transgressors is hard.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:16
verses.text: Every prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open his folly.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:17
verses.text: A wicked messenger falleth into mischief: but a faithful ambassador is health.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:18
verses.text: Poverty and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but he that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:19
verses.text: The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul: but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:20
verses.text: He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be destroyed.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:21
verses.text: Evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteous good shall be repayed.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:22
verses.text: A good man leaveth an inheritance to his children’s children: and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:23
verses.text: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:24
verses.text: He that spareth his rod hateth his son: but he that loveth him chasteneth him betimes.

verses.name: Proverbs 13:25
verses.text: The righteous eateth to the satisfying of his soul: but the belly of the wicked shall want.
